alert.note: Alert for Ellis; Kaufman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 28 at 12:25AM CDT until October 28 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Ellis and Kaufman. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waxahachie, Ennis, Terrell, Red Oak, Kaufman, Palmer, Bardwell, Grays Prairie, Alma, Cottonwood, Bardwell Lake, Garrett, Scurry, Bristol, Pecan Hill, Oak Grove, Post Oak Bend City, Rosser, Oak Ridge and Telico.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
